website_summaries.verdict: A good starter board with features to help keep you from losing it in the water.
pros: Includes a hook and loop strap and a wrist guard
Bright yellow makes it easy to spot in the water
cons: The hard plastic could come back and bang you up in the water

customer_reviews.title: Lanyard broke on first outing.
customer_reviews.text: Product works well and I like the design and color. The lanyard however is another story. The first day at the beach, the lanyard broke. The quality of the stitching was really poor where the neoprene padding is secured to the nylon strap. The padding was not even lined up straight. I think that a simple Paracord solution is in order as I do not want to pay for any replacement parts from the company.
customer_reviews.author: M. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Great design, very portable for taking to the beach.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed by the design and functionality of this product. Easy to swim with, and allows for long, controlled body surfing waves. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Reed

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This product is kinda like you get what you pay for. It's one of the cheapest hand boards on the market, monetarily and the way it's built. It does the job allowing you to catch some waves but it you have the money to get yourself a Sylde Handboard I recommend that one
customer_reviews.author: Southern Pride

customer_reviews.title: Most fun using the hydro board
customer_reviews.text: Great hand board for the price. So much more fun body surfing when using a hand board.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: First time I’ve used a hand plane for body surfing... I was impressed how well this worked
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: So much fun :)
customer_reviews.text: Great, fun product. First time body surfer here (although I've been stand up surfing for nigh on 30 years). It gives you heaps of lift and generates lots of down-the-line speed. Affordable too. Combined with a good pair of fins, you should have a blast with this. This old sea dog certainly is anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Campbell Gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing handboards!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great handboards! I am a bodysurfing nut who rides all waves big and small and these work amazing! I use them also in a duel format and it is awesome.

customer_reviews.title: I like that you can still swim (paddle) with it while ...
customer_reviews.text: Light material, it doesn t hurt fingers as wood board does after using it for a long time. I like that you can still swim (paddle) with it while trying to catch the wave, other boards does not. Had great time

customer_reviews.text: Light, Strap is great construction, works great in the surf. A must have for your quiver

customer_reviews.title: old Son had a great time with small waves at NC beaches
customer_reviews.text: 23 yr. old Son had a great time with small waves at NC beaches. He enjoyed the Hydro more than a boogie board said was much much faster.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny surfing!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my yorkie was looking for! He's always loved to paddle out but this takes his game to a whole new level. Four paws up!

customer_reviews.title: I had never used one of these and I feel like I have more success without
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bummed. I had never used one of these and I feel like I have more success without. It seemed to get in the way when trying to swim moving in my hand. I felt this should improve body surfing and be alot easier to adjust.

customer_reviews.text: I surf, body board, and body surf since the 80's. I used it at makapu'u, keikis, sandys, off the wall, bowls and walls and waimea shorebreak, its a solid handplane people trip on how fast it propels you through the water. late take offs and even take off outside on swells it works good.
